result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine D Griggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay court costs.    Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge, mandatory surcharges began in 2014.  Defendant is granted a payment plan in the amount of $50.00 per month beginning 12/30/19.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

With huber for work search, work and childcare.  DO NOT REPORT IN LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED. Defendant is to receive good time credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine D Griggs

records.addlTxt: Letter ref Case Closure from SPD Appointment of Counsel

10:02 AM Defendant Antoine D Griggs in court with attorney Raymond Gamez.  Defendant Antoine D Griggs in custody.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  Amended Informations are filed in both cases.  
In case 15CF507 Upon a  plea to ct. 1 and both counts of BJ in 15CF1819.   State recommends jail, def. is free to argue the amount.  Judge conducts her plea colloquy.  Parties stipulate to the use of the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters a plea of NO CONTEST to 15CF507 Ct. 1 and in 15CF1819 both counts and is found GUILTY by the Court.  There isn't a factual basis for 2 counts of BJ in 15CF1819 but it was charged as 2 BJs and a CM possession as a consideration.  State presents it's sentencing argument.  Defense presents it's sentencing argument.  
K Wedgeworth speaks on the defendants behalf.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  

BTC:
15CF507     Ct. 1 -  Possess THC    3 mo RCJ

15CF1819  Ct. 1 -  BJ   6 mo RCJ conc to 507
                     Ct. 2 -  BJ   6 mo RCJ conc to 507 and to count 1    all counts with huber for work search and work and child care

CFTS  from 6/25/19 to 10/4/19 with good time Credit
DNA sample and surcharges on 15CF507 and on 15CF1819.  Mandatory testing started in 2014.  
PPP  $50/mo to begin 12/30/19. 

CFTS  6/25/19 to 10/4/19=102 days.    Defendant was not in custody in 2015/2016.  

New address:  4729 N 50th Street  Milwaukee  53218

Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
